title: Roman, similar to Times New
content:
I’m sure this is common but it has got me stumped. It is similar to Times New Roman except it has that slight curve in the tail of the R. Everything I’ve looked at so far either has a very straight tail with a flat base or a much more exagerrated curve.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040341im_/http:/typophile.com/files/theroux%20roman_4960.jpg)

 [‹ Sans Serif mystery!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040341/http:/typophile.com/node/48839 "Go to previous forum topic") [does anyone know what these are???? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040341/http:/typophile.com/node/48835 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Justin_Ch

comments.content: Thanks Jan. I’ve been seeing that R on a few other book jackets today.
